snippet: As cities crack down on an apparent rise in aggressive panhandling, advocates for the homeless say sweeping bans go too far. Several recent legal decisions have favored the homeless.
abstract: Advocates for the homeless say sweeping bans against panhandling are going too far as cities across country crack down on apparent rise in aggressive panhandling; several legal decisions around the country have favored homeless claims that panhandling is a right.
lead_paragraph: As cities crack down on an apparent rise in aggressive panhandling, advocates for the homeless say sweeping bans go too far. Several recent legal decisions have favored the homeless.

headline.seo: Homeless Are Fighting Back in Court Against Panhandling Bans
headline.main: Homeless Are Fighting Back Against Panhandling Bans
headline.print_headline: Homeless Are Fighting Back Against Panhandling Bans
